alert.note: Alert for Floyd (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 6:09PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Floyd County through 645 PM CDT... At 608 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles east of South Plains, or 15 miles southwest of Caprock Canyon State Park, moving southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... South Plains. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
